message_1: John has 3 apples, while Jane has 5 apples. Using higher-order logic, demonstrate how to represent the number of apples John has in terms of the number of apples Jane has.
message_2:
Let J represent the number of apples John has, and let A represent the number of apples Jane has. We are given the following information:

J = 3
A = 5

We want to represent J in terms of A. Since John has 3 apples and Jane has 5 apples, we can write the relationship between J and A as:

J = A - 2

This equation represents the number of apples John has (J) in terms of the number of apples Jane has (A).
